page.title: 07BIOGRAPHIES
page.content:
Sir Stanley Matthews' father was a boxer and a barber, his name was Jack Matthews.Jack lives above his barber's shop in Wellington Road, Hanley and this is where Stanley was born and lived and why he came to our school.In his famous football career,Sir Stanley played for Stoke City,Blackpool and had a place on the England team.He visited our school,Hanley St Luke's, and taught our school footballers his magical skills. Sir Stanley,now seventy years old,lives in Canada.
The son of the people who kept the Plough Inn in the High Street,Hanley rode the wall of death between l925 and 1930.He was killed during a local Wakes holiday.At his funeral was a wreath in the shape of a motor cycle,local people remember.
